text: Tobolsk is part of the Tyumen Oblast in Russia. It is near many rivers. It is one of the few towns in Russia that have stone fortresses, known as kremlins. According to the census in 2021, 100,352 people live inside it.https://rosstat.gov.ru/storage/mediabank/tab-5_VPN-2020.xlsx Its economy depends mostly on its oil. In February 1917, Nicholas II abdicated the throne, and his family, including his youngest daughter Anastasia, were moved to Tobolsk.King Greg, Wilson Penny (2003). The Fate of the Romanovs. John Wiley and Sons, Inc. == References == == Further reading == * Brumfield, William Tobolsk: Architectural Heritage in Photographs Moscow: Tri Kvadrata, 2006 (in English and in Russian) Category:Cities and towns in Tyumen Oblast
title: Tobolsk
